members.name: Event()
members.description: Creates an Event object, returning it to the caller.

parameters.name: typeArg
parameters.description: Is a DOMString representing the name of the event.

members.name: Event.bubbles
members.description: A Boolean indicating whether the event bubbles up through the DOM or not.

members.name: Event.cancelBubble
members.description: A historical alias to Event.stopPropagation(). Setting its value to true before returning from an event handler prevents propagation of the event.

members.name: Event.cancelable
members.description: A Boolean indicating whether the event is cancelable.

members.name: Event.composed
members.description: A Boolean value indicating whether or not the event can bubble across the boundary between the shadow DOM and the regular DOM.

members.name: Event.currentTarget
members.description: A reference to the currently registered target for the event. This is the object to which the event is currently slated to be sent; it's possible this has been changed along the way through retargeting.

members.name: Event.deepPath
members.description: An Array of DOM Nodes through which the event has bubbled.

members.name: Event.defaultPrevented
members.description: Indicates whether or not event.preventDefault() has been called on the event.

members.name: Event.eventPhase
members.description: Indicates which phase of the event flow is being processed.

members.name: Event.explicitOriginalTarget
members.description: The explicit original target of the event (Mozilla-specific).

members.name: Event.originalTarget
members.description: The original target of the event, before any retargetings (Mozilla-specific).

members.name: Event.returnValue
members.description: A non-standard alternative (from old versions of Microsoft Internet Explorer) to Event.preventDefault() and Event.defaultPrevented.

members.name: Event.scoped
members.description: A Boolean indicating whether the given event will bubble across through the shadow root into the standard DOM. This property has been renamed to composed.

members.name: Event.srcElement
members.description: A non-standard alias (from old versions of Microsoft Internet Explorer) for Event.target.

members.name: Event.target
members.description: A reference to the target to which the event was originally dispatched.

members.name: Event.timeStamp
members.description: The time at which the event was created, in milliseconds. By specification, this value is time since epoch, but in reality browsers' definitions vary; in addition, work is underway to change this to be a DOMHighResTimeStamp instead.

members.name: Event.type
members.description: The name of the event (case-insensitive).

members.name: Event.isTrusted
members.description: Indicates whether or not the event was initiated by the browser (after a user click for instance) or by a script (using an event creation method, like event.initEvent)

members.name: Event.initEvent()
members.description: Initializes the value of an Event created. If the event has already being dispatched, this method does nothing.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Is a DOMString defining the type of event.

parameters.name: bubbles
parameters.description: Is a Boolean deciding whether the event should bubble up through the event chain or not. Once set, the read-only property Event.bubbles will give its value.

parameters.name: cancelable
parameters.description: Is a Boolean defining whether the event can be canceled. Once set, the read-only property Event.cancelable will give its value.

members.name: Event.preventBubble()
members.description: Prevents the event from bubbling. Obsolete, use event.stopPropagation instead.

members.name: Event.preventCapture()
members.description: Obsolete, use event.stopPropagation instead.

members.name: Event.preventDefault()
members.description: Cancels the event (if it is cancelable).

members.name: Event.stopImmediatePropagation()
members.description: For this particular event, no other listener will be called. Neither those attached on the same element, nor those attached on elements which will be traversed later (in capture phase, for instance)

members.name: Event.stopPropagation()
members.description: Stops the propagation of events further along in the DOM.

members.name: Event.getPreventDefault()
members.description: Non-standard. Returns the value of Event.defaultPrevented. Use Event.defaultPrevented instead.
